intro: Hesperis matronalis subsp. oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sweet rocket, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Europe. It features upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and have a slightly serrated edge. The plant produces clusters of bright pink to purple flowers with four petals, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long flowering period and attractive foliage.
